intro: Canthium manense, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive glandular texture. Canthium manense is adapted to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed habitats.
